events.message: The customer reported a car accident that happened yesterday involving a collision at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to keywords such as collision and vehicle.
An insurance agent specializing in vehicle accidents was assigned to handle the claim and assist the customer.
The claim acknowledgment notification was sent to the customer promptly, confirming receipt of the auto accident report.
The customer was asked to submit the accident report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and a police report for review.
All requested documents related to the vehicle collision, including repair estimates and police documentation, were submitted.
The investigation team began examining the submitted documents and photos to verify the details of the car accident claim.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of collision details and validated customer's version of events and damage extent.
A settlement offer was prepared and proposed to the customer based on damage assessment and policy coverage limits.
The customer expressed dissatisfaction with the proposed settlement amount, indicating it was insufficient to cover repairs.
Due to feedback dissatisfaction, the claim was escalated to a senior claims adjuster for further review and reconsideration.
After reevaluation, the claim was approved with an increased settlement offer that better reflects the repair costs.
Payment for the approved claim amount was issued to the customerâ€™s bank account to cover the vehicle repair expenses.
The claim was officially closed after the customer confirmed receipt of payment and satisfaction with the claim handling process.
The claim documentation and records were archived for future reference and compliance purposes after closing.
